The best treatment for hair loss depends on the underlying cause of the condition. Your doctor can help determine the most appropriate treatment for you.

Both medications have been shown to be effective in preventing hair loss and promoting hair regrowth.

2. Hair Transplant Surgery

Hair transplant surgery involves taking hair from a donor area (usually the back of the head) and transplanting it to the balding area. The procedure can be expensive and requires a skilled surgeon, but it can provide long-lasting results.

Lifestyle Changes for Hair Health

Heat styling tools like flat irons and blow dryers can also cause curly hair to become straight. When you apply heat to your hair, it can break down the protein bonds that give your hair its natural shape, causing it to become straight. Over time, frequent heat styling can cause permanent damage to your hair, making it difficult to maintain any texture. If you want to straighten your hair without causing permanent damage, try using a heat protectant spray and limiting your use of heat styling tools.

Chemical treatments like relaxers and keratin treatments can also cause curly hair to become straight. How to do Microneedling for Hair Loss

Microneedling for hair loss can be done at home using a derma roller or at a salon or clinic using a microneedling pen or device. While doing it at home is more affordable, it's important to note that microneedling devices used by professionals are usually more effective and provide better results.

If you decide to do microneedling for hair loss at home, you'll need to purchase a derma roller with needles that are 1.5 mm or shorter. Longer needles can cause more damage to the scalp and should only be used by professionals.

Step-by-Step Guide on Microneedling for Hair Loss

Here's a step-by-step guide on how to do microneedling for hair loss:

  1. Wash your hair and scalp with a gentle shampoo and let it dry completely.
  2. Clean the derma roller with rubbing alcohol and let it dry completely.
  3. Divide your hair into sections and clip the sections away from the area you want to microneedle.
  4. Gently roll the derma roller over the area in a vertical, horizontal, and diagonal pattern. Roll over each area 10-15 times.
  5. Apply a hair growth serum or oil to the microneedled area.
  6. Repeat the process once a week for at least 3 months.
